rev.comment: fixed meaning of "drive" in computer science
rev.diff:
Line 3: Line 3:
* In [[physics]], ''drive'' means to impart forward motion to by physical [[force]].
* In [[physics]], ''drive'' means to impart forward motion to by physical [[force]].
* In [[psychology]], ''drive'' is an alternate name for [[motivation]].
* In [[psychology]], ''drive'' is an alternate name for [[motivation]].
â
* In [[computing]], ''drive'' is a device for [[mass storage]].
+
* In [[computing]], ''drive'' is a device that reads data and often writes data onto a storage medium (like a [[Floppy disk|floppy]] or CD).
* In [[electrical engineering]], a ''drive'' is an electronic device to provide power to a [[electric motor|motor]] or [[servomechanism|servo]]. Please see [[Motor controller]] for details.
* In [[electrical engineering]], a ''drive'' is an electronic device to provide power to a [[electric motor|motor]] or [[servomechanism|servo]]. Please see [[Motor controller]] for details.
* In [[cricket]], a drive is a generic name for a number of shots played by a [[Batsman]] that tend to go in front of the batsman or 'down the ground'.
* In [[cricket]], a drive is a generic name for a number of shots played by a [[Batsman]] that tend to go in front of the batsman or 'down the ground'.
